Author: sportyspice303

Comment: In order for the government to make an arrest they need to witness you committing the crime in real time, have probable cause you committed the crime in question, or have a warrant. There is also exigent circumstances which would be the risk of evidence being destroyed (which does not apply here) or an imminent threat to public safety (which also does not apply here).   Being in the country after your green card is revoked is not a crime because you are given time to self deport. Which is irrelevant since Khalil was taken into custody on March 8th and the administration didn't even announce plans to revoke his green card until March 12th meaning that when he was arrested he had a valid and current green card.
